trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ModeChanging"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ModeChanging> event is raised when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control attempts to change between edit, insert, and read-only mode, but before the mode actually changes.

This allows you to provide an event handler that performs a custom routine, such as configuring the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control for a specific mode or canceling the mode change, whenever this event occurs.

A DetailsViewModeEventArgs object is passed to the event handler, which allows you to determine the mode to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control is changing, to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ModeChanging> event was raised as a result of the user canceling an edit operation, or to indicate that an insert operation should be canceled.
To determine the new mode, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewModeEventArgs.NewMode%2A> property.

You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewModeEventArgs.NewMode%2A> property to change to an alternate mode by setting it to one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewMode> enumeration values.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewModeEventArgs.CancelingEdit%2A> property to determine whether the user canceled an edit operation.
To cancel an insert operation, set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the DetailsViewModeEventArgs class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewModeEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewModeEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewModeEventArgs> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewModeEventArgs> class.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewModeEventArgs.CancelingEdit%2A>|The value of the `cancelingEdit` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewModeEventArgs.NewMode%2A>|The value of the `mode` parameter.| > [!NOTE] > This constructor is used primarily by control developers when raising events.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewMode"></xref> enumeration values.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ModeChanging"></xref> event was raised as a result of the user canceling an edit operation; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ModeChanging"></xref> event was raised as a result of the user canceling an edit operation.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ModeChanging> event is raised when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control attempts to change between edit, insert, and read-only mode, but before the mode actually changes.
Use the CancelingEdit property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ModeChanging> event was raised as a result of the user canceling an edit operation.
For example, you might want to reset the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control whenever the user cancels an edit operation.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ModeChanging"></xref> event was raised as a result of the user canceling an edit operation; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the mode to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control is changing.
Use the NewMode property to determine the mode to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control is changing.
For example, you might want to configure the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control based on the mode to which it changes.

You can also use this property to specify the mode to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control changes by setting it to one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewMode> enumeration values.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewMode"></xref> enumeration values.
